subject: Junit, classpath, and eclipse

messageBody:
I have been given the task at my workplace to be the junit guru for
our development team. While we have the basic shell in place to make
use of it, no one has, and our manager wants to start.

I downloaded the jUnitDoclet code so that we could generate a junit
shell for our whole application, and slowly start filling it out, and
am encountering a few difficulties. I am trying to getting running in
Eclipse. I have set it up as an external tool as per the instructions.
I have had to do a few fiddly fixes due to spaces being in used here
and there in our path (source code is in a "Java Source" directory),
but that's fine, I figured that all out.

What I am having trouble with, is the classpath. I know I can pass a
classpath as a parameter to the run_junitdoclet.bat file, though I am
having difficulty making even that work. What I would really like, is
to have it run, using the classpath of my specific project. I would
prefer it being project relevant so that the same logic will work on
any project. The problem is that as it runs, it creates a whole pile
of compiler errors indicating that x reference or y package doesn't
exist. Now sometimes, despite that, it will still create the test
class, so ultimately, it seems to work (if you just ignore over a
hundred error mesages). Other times, it seems there are too many
errors for the test class to get written. This really prevents me from
just trying to build every class in our application (way to many to go
one by one).

So...can I get it to use the project classpath, if not, what am I
missing from passing in classpath as a parameter. I added

".\Web Content\WEB-INF\lib"

as a classpath parameter, which does help, as I don't seem to get any
errors for any jar files that fall into this area, and this is
*always* a relevant area, but we do reference other jar files as well,
in some cases other projects, and in some cases external directories
entirely (like Tomcat's common\lib folder). I tried extending it to..

".\Web Content\WEB-INF\lib;C:\Tomcat 5.0\common\lib\"

and I get an error

"Content\WEB-INF\lib was unexpected at this time."

so I am getting a little puzzled, and I just realized how long this
message is, thanks for geting this far.
